file_content.text: The dark side's strong with you. Too strong. Saving you is beyond my power.
Such strength... you could have served the galaxy brilliantly....
What're you waiting for? Overload the reactor--let's toast this place and kill these freaks!
Say goodbye to your pets, Sulan.
Done. [Overload reactor]
The Jedi was close to those monsters. Let's hope he shared their pain.
Though he'd have died quicker--and messier--if you'd left him to me.
I'm the only reason his nekghouls aren't feasting on you.
Sulan would have killed you.
You'd like that, wouldn't you?
Sulan didn't need to endure your torment.
He deserved a clean death.
There's no point in killing if you can't have a little fun.
Arrogant as always.
I just call it like I see it.
Taris still crawls with Republic scum, and my lightsaber's itching for their throats. Don't even think about following me.
Look at yourselves--weak lapdogs to a pathetic Jedi. Follow his teachings and you'll die like him.
No. They could be allies.
But if you want to gain the kind of power I hold, embrace the darkness inside you!
Instead, you must embrace your strength. Rise against the Republic and strike them down!
Sulan. You promised us prosperity, but your Republic is weak.
No! Don't let your anger erase everything you've learned. You still have a future on Taris!
But not with you.
Why did you let them go? We could've made the nekghouls extinct!
This way, we can push the nekghouls to fight the Republic.
They're more valuable alive.
I say melt the monsters and be done with them.
Taris has seen enough death.
Next time, grow a backbone.
Back off, Thana.
If I were you, I wouldn't want to talk about my cowardice either.
Taris calls out for more destruction, and I'm answering. Keep your distance or I'll carve my name into your hide.
I knew I should've sent more droids your way.
Back, my students. Remember your teachings.
I sense much anger in you, Sith. But it's not too late. I can help you overcome the Empire's torments.
The dark side fuels my strength. With it, I'll destroy Taris and your pathetic order.
The words of an ignorant Jedi.
Power comes at the price of corruption.
Your kind once tried to wipe out the Sith. You'll do the same again.
I can't trust a Jedi.
I seek to banish the dark side, not kill those who practice it.
Sure, let's talk.
You're surrounded by enemies and deception. I can offer an alternative to Imperial servitude.
The Republic's decaying. Soon the Empire will stomp it out and rule the galaxy.
Don't make me laugh.
Look past the Imperial propaganda.
I know the art of propaganda, Jedi. You can't entice me over to your side.
You don't fool me.
Your greed has led you astray, hunter. The Republic offers rewards far greater than credits.
Imperial contracts involve bloodshed--lots of it. You can't beat that.
My tastes run darker.
I can cure your taste for violence.
Unfortunately for you, I happen to like credits.
I don't turn on my employers.
I sense the light inside you. Don't ignore it.
Rewards, eh?
Idiot! He's got nothing to offer!
That's not correct. Just look at my students.
The Emperor has enslaved all of you. There's still time to break free of his grasp.
Before you die, I'm going to crush your nekghouls. You get to watch.
I'd rather break you.
Don't be so quick to condemn my work.
I am my own master.
I'm no slave.
The puppet never sees its strings, but I can help you break them.
You're talking nonsense.
I wouldn't have said anything if you didn't have potential.
Like you, these nekghouls were confused, angry, destructive. Now I heal them with the Force and guide them towards the light side.
School's out, Jedi. Your pupils are done for.
Not if I can help it.
I can't let you interrupt their education.
Nekghouls were spawned by the Sith. They're meant to follow the dark side.
You're corrupting them.
No. My instruction is helping them achieve true greatness.
These mutants are mindless killers. They'll never learn.
You can't teach monsters.
You are the ignorant one. Very well, then.
You're dead. All of you.
Shut up and die. [Attack]
Come, my students. Show them what you've learned!
